body: Use `HANDLE_TH_ERRORS` `END_HANDLE_TH_ERRORS` in your Python C functions. They surround everything with a try/catch that turns C++ exceptions to Python exceptions.  It's safe even if you don't think things throw and it doesn't add runtime overhead.
